subtitles.text: Roads in cities are the lifelines of urban life, connecting neighborhoods, businesses, and people.
They facilitate the flow of traffic, enabling us to commute, explore, and access essential services.
Well-designed roads can enhance the functionality of a city, reducing congestion and improving safety.
Yet, the challenge of urban planning lies in balancing road space with pedestrian areas, green spaces, and public transport systems.
As cities grow, so must our approach to roads, integrating smart technologies and sustainable designs.
We must ensure they serve the needs of everyone, while minimizing environmental impact.
